newsitem.title: USA: Quickturn Design sees Q1 EPS loss.
newsitem.headline: Quickturn Design sees Q1 EPS loss.

text.p: Quickturn Design Systems Inc said on Tuesday that it expects to report a first quarter loss of between $0.10 and $0.13 per share on revenue of between $20 million and $21 million.
The company had revenues of $23.9 million in the first quarter of 1996, and $30.7 million in the fourth quarter.
Analysts on average have estimated first quarter earnings per share at $0.20, according to First Call.
Both the first and and fourth quarter revenue figures for 1996 include the effects of the February 1997 pooling-of-interests merger with SpeedSim Inc, the company said.

In a statement, President and Chief Executive Keith Lobo said, "The normal pattern of high end-of-quarter order activity did not materialize in this quarter. This reduction of order activity was evident particularly across the United States and Europe and to a lesser extent in the Asia-Pacific."
He said the company was cautious in the short-term about the return to historic order rates.
